abstract: Wilson Roberto Palacios Suazo (Spanish pronunciation: [wilˈsom paˈlasjos]; born 29 July 1984) is a Honduran footballer who plays in the Premier League for Stoke City. Born in La Ceiba, he played for Victoria and Olimpia in Honduras before moving to England where he played for Birmingham City and Wigan Athletic. In 2009 he joined Tottenham Hotspur, generally playing central defensive midfield as he did for previous club Wigan. He was occasionally used for Tottenham Hotspur as a right midfielder. He has been a regular player for Honduras since 2003, helping them qualify for the 2010 FIFA World Cup for the second time in their history. In August 2011 Palacios joined Stoke City for an undisclosed fee believed to be around £6 million.
